One of the best films ever

To earn the inheritance left by his wealthy grandfather, a young man must abandon his self-centred life of pleasure and laziness, and complete a series of tasks that prove life changing, not just for him, but also for many others.

The film's overall message about giving is a very positive one, and comes across very clearly. There were some weaknesses, namely 1. The absence of a faith which shapes and underlies the change of character; 2. The concession to a superficial romance based on feelings, which ends all too predictably and favourably; 3. The character of the sick young girl is very unnatural, although this can be accepted for the sake of the film's main premise.

But despite some flaws, it's still a film with a positive and worthwhile message, and the storyline is entertaining as the main character learns some valuable and important life-lessons in an unusual way. I look forward to reading the book that inspired the film! - Godly Gadfly (July 2018)

We loved this movie and are glad we purchased it so we can watch it multiple times. It's based on a novel, but is the type of movie that you can imagine is possible to be based on a true story. It presents some interesting life situations to cause self reflection and has the potential to cause people to change their outlook on what is truly important in life. It also provides ideas to consider for estate planning for those who hope their heirs will give careful consideration to the use of their inheritances. We look forward to seeing the other movies in this "Ultimate" series.
